titles.title: Improving Coverage for Substance Use Disorder Recovery Expansion Act

A bill to amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide States with the option to provide medical assistance for substance use disorder treatment services to individuals between the ages of 21 and 64 with substance use disorders, and for other purposes.
Improving Coverage for Substance Use Disorder Recovery Expansion Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
Improving Coverage for Substance Use Disorder Recovery Expansion Act
This bill allows state Medicaid programs to cover certain inpatient substance-use disorder treatment services for individuals who are 21 to 64 years of age.
